activities: Sony Corporation of America will use and otherwise process personally identifiable information ("Personal Information") about employees in Europe for the following purposes:  business contacts and communications; personnel administration; compensation-related activities, including compensation and bonus/budget analysis and administration and stock plan administration; recruitment activities; performance management; talent development; corporate administration and governance; management planning and reporting; legal advice; responding to legal process, such as subpoenas, pursuing legal rights and remedies, defending litigation and managing inquiries, claims, complaints or investigations; provision of compliance-related training; monitoring and enforcement of compliance with laws, regulations and company policies and procedures, including the investigation of allegations of misconduct; IT support and services; information security and data privacy; performance of audits; tax filings and analysis; insurance administration; travel arrangements; corporate security and/or emergency/crisis management assistance; negotiations or due diligence for a transfer or reorganization of all or part of the Company; and with respect to directors and officers of SCA affiliate companies, for the purposes of shareholder consents relating to annual appointments of directors and officers.
